title: Assistant Operations Manager Job at R & R Recruiting Services
content:
R & R Recruiting Services is a Recruitment Agency that offers Training, Consulting, & Human Resources Management services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Operations Manager

Job Location: Akute, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Furniture

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Assist the Operations Manager in daily production activities
	Ensure all production team tasks are properly carried out
	Monitor workflow and support team coordination
	Ensure production targets and timelines are met
	Report operational issues and progress
	Support compliance with procedures and safety standards.


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess aN OND / HND / B.Sc Degree with 2 - 3 years of experience.


Remuneration
Salary: N120,000 Monthly + Accommodation.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: r2recruitmentservices@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For inquiries, send a WhatsApp message to: 09035411252.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Communications Strategist Job at Intersex Nigeria




        
    

        
        Intersex Nigeria (Center for Healthcare Development and Youth Empowerment) is an intersex-led and focused Non-Governmental Organization in Nigeria. We promote and advocate for the sexual reproductive health, self-determination, bodily autonomy, and overall human rights of intersex people in all diversity in Nigeria. Through community building, advocacy, evidence-based research, empowerment, educational and informational resources on intersex-related issues to the public, partners, stakeholders, and our community.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Communications Strategist

Job Location: Abuja
Job type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a Communications Strategist that will lead the development and execution of strategic communications that amplify intersex voices and strengthen our public presence.
	The ideal candidate is a Strategic storyteller, skilled communicator and right-based advocate with experience in graphic design, website management and
	They will be responsible for shaping the organization's public image, amplifying intersex voices, and ensuring inclusive, sensitive, and accurate representation of intersex persons in all communications.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement a comprehensive communications strategy aligned with organizational goals and advocacy priorities.
	Support advocacy campaigns, policy engagement, and public education initiatives through strategic communications.
	Ensure consistent branding, messaging, and tone across all communication platforms.
	Create and manage annual communication plans and content calendars.
	Design high-quality digital materials including social media graphics, infographics, reports, flyers, and campaign assets.
	Manage and regularly update the organization's website, ensuring content accuracy, accessibility, and relevance.
	Coordinate basic website maintenance, including layout updates, image optimization, and broken-link checks.
	Track website and social media analytics to assess performance and improve engagement.
	Draft press releases, media statements, and advocacy briefs.
	Support media engagement and external communications with partners, donors, and stakeholders.
	Ensure ethical, respectful, and consent-based storytelling of intersex experiences.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in communications, Public Relations, Media Studies, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in communications, media, or advocacy (preferably within a non-profit or rights-based organization).
	Strong understanding and commitment to intersex and human rights advocacy.
	Proven experience in digital design and visual content creation.
	Strong writing, editing skills, and story telling skills with the ability to adapt tone for different audiences.
	Demonstrated experience in website management and content publishing.
	Proficiency in design tools such as Canva, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) or similar.
	Experience managing social media platforms and digital campaigns.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
	Ability to use Zoho software is a plus.


Required Competencies:


	Strong understanding of communication strategies, media engagement, and digital advocacy.
	Excellent writing, editing, and storytelling skills.
	Proficiency in managing social media platforms and content creation tools.
	Creative thinking and ability to translate complex issues into compelling messages.
	Knowledge of intersex and human rights contexts in Nigeria is an asset.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: jobs@intersexnigeria.org using "Communications Strategist" as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only selected candidates will be contacted.
	Intersex Nigeria is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from qualified individuals regardless of gender, sex, sexual orientation, (dis)ability, religion, or ethnic background.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Facility & Works Officer",
  "description": "Grundtvig International Secondary School is a multi-award-winning co-educational boarding school owned by the Grundtvig Movement of Nigeria, a non-governmental organisation committed to the development of &ldquo;Education for Life&rdquo; in Nigeria. The Board of Trustees of the Grundtvig Movement controls the operations of the school through the principal. The Grundtvig Movement is inspired by the Danish Education-for-Life philosopher Bishop N.F.S. Grundtvig (1783-1872) and our rich tradition.

Employment Type: Full-time
Job Type: Hybrid

About the Role


	Our client is seeking a highly experienced Core Network &amp; signaling Engineer to design, operate, and evolve the end-to-end MVNO core network, ensuring seamless interworking with multiple Mobile Network Operators (MNOs) and third-party service platforms.
	This role requires deep, hands-on expertise in telecom core networks, signaling (SS7 / Diameter / SIP), voice and data services, and proven experience working within the MNO environments.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for architecture, deployment, interconnectivity, troubleshooting, optimization, and regulatory compliance of the MVNO core infrastructure.


Key Responsibilities
Core Network Operations &amp; Management:


	Design, deploy, and maintain core network elements including HLR/HSS, MME, SGSN, GGSN, PGW, SGW, and IMS components
	Manage SIP-based voice services including VoLTE, VoWiFi, and traditional circuit-switched voice interconnections
	Configure and optimize signaling interfaces (Diameter, SS7/SIGTRAN, SIP/IMS) between MVNO core and host MNO networks
	Implement and maintain roaming agreements and interconnect configurations with partner networks


Network Interworking &amp; Integration:


	Lead technical integration projects with host MNO networks, ensuring proper MAP, Diameter, and SIP protocol implementations
	Configure and troubleshoot IPX/GRX connections for international roaming and signaling
	Manage relationships with host MNOs on technical matters including interface specifications, capacity planning, and service enablement
	Coordinate with vendors and partners on core network equipment and service delivery


Technical Support &amp; Troubleshooting:


	Perform advanced troubleshooting of core network issues including call setup failures, registration problems, and data session issues
	Lead incident response for major network outages and service-affecting issues


Planning &amp; Optimization:


	Monitor network performance and capacity, recommending upgrades and optimizations
	Develop and maintain network architecture documentation and operational procedures


Required Qualifications
Education:


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in related field or equivalent practical experience
	Relevant certifications (general or vendor-specific certifications) are highly valued


Experience:


	5-7 years of hands-on experience in mobile core networks with MNO or MVNO operators. Extensive experience with SS7, SIGTRAN, Diameter, and SIP protocols
	Proven track record of working with multiple core network vendors (e.g., Ericsson, Nokia, Huawei, Mavenir)
	Direct experience with MVNO architecture and host MNO integration


Technical Skills


	Expert knowledge of 2G/3G/4G core network architecture (MSC, HLR, SGSN, GGSN, MME, HSS, PGW, SGW)
	Deep understanding of IMS architecture and VoLTE/VoWiFi implementations
	Proficiency in signaling protocols: MAP, CAP, INAP, Diameter, SIP, MGCP, SIGTRAN
	Strong knowledge of routing protocols and IP networking (MPLS, BGP, OSPF)
	Experience with network monitoring and troubleshooting tools (Wireshark, protocol analyzers, element management systems)


Mindset:


	A proactive problem-solver who can operate in a fast-paced, &quot;startup-style&quot; MVNO environment while maintaining &quot;telco-grade&quot; reliability.


Personal Attributes:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail
	Excellent communication skills for technical discussions with MNO partners and vendors
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities
	Team player with collaborative approach to network operations
	Adaptable to rapidly changing technology and business requirements.


Salary
N800,000 - N1,200,000 / Month.
